item.title: Manchester locals open doors to concert-goers stranded after 'terror attack'
item.description: Manchester locals open their doors and offer transport to people stranded after a suspected terrorist incident at an Ariana Grande concert, with the nearby train station shut down.

media:group.media:description: People hug outside Manchester Arena after the explosion. (AP: Peter Byrne)

item.title: TasTafe boss Stephen Conway resigns after misconduct finding
item.description: Head of TasTafe Stephen Conway resigns as the Integrity Commission finds he gave his deputy, a close friend, favourable treatment resulting in "improper financial and career advantages".
item.dc:creator: Georgie Burgess

media:group.media:description: Stephen Conway resigned after an anonymous tip-off prompted an Integrity Commission inquiry. (Supplied: TasTafe)

item.title: Reaction to WA Inc comments 'almost hysterical', Barnett says
item.description: Former WA premier Colin Barnett says there has been an almost "hysterical response" to his comments last week warning the state is at risk of a repeat of WA Inc-era scandals.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Kagi

media:group.media:description: Mr Barnett says he made no allegations, only observations. (News Video)

item.title: Paedophile trial abandoned, search underway after accused fails to show
item.description: The trial of Alfred John Impicciatore, one of the Perth men accused of involvement in a paedophile ring, is abandoned after he again fails to turn up to court.
item.dc:creator: Joanna Menagh

media:group.media:description: It is not the first time Alfred John Impicciatore has failed to answer his bail. (Supplied: Linkedin)

item.title: Joint counter-terrorism force arrests SA woman
item.description: A South Australian woman is arrested in connection with an alleged terrorism offence by a joint team of local and federal police, but authorities say there is no link to events in Manchester.

item.title: Safety at fatal Sydney bout inadequate, David Browne's wife tells inquest
item.description: The wife of professional boxer David "Davey" Browne, who died after a bout in 2015, tells a coronial inquest safety procedures at the fatal Sydney match were inadequate and that it should be a "wake-up call" for the sport in Australia.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Chettle

media:group.media:description: David Browne's widow Amy Lavelle watched her husband deteriorate in the ring. (ABC News: Ursula Malone)

item.title: Banks punch $2b hole in budget forecasts
item.description: The big four banks estimate the bank levy will cost them less than $4 billion combined - well short of the Government's plan to earn more than $6 billion from them over the next four years.
item.dc:creator: David Chau

media:group.media:description: Logos from the four big banks in Australia - CBA, Westpac, NAB and ANZ. (AAP)

item.title: AFLW star Erin Phillips sticks with Crows for 2018
item.description: AFLW best and fairest and club champion Erin Phillips announces will return to the Adelaide Crows for the 2018 season.

media:group.media:description: Erin Phillips had a massive first year in the AFLW with the Adelaide Crows. (AAP: Tracey Nearmy)

item.title: Manchester Arena concert 'terror incident' in pictures
item.description: Numerous witnesses describe the scene before and after a concert explosion that British authorities are treating as a possible terror incident. Here are a selection of pictures taken in the immediate aftermath.

media:group.media:description: Two women wrapped in thermal blankets stand near the Manchester Arena in northern England, Britain, where US singer Ariana Grande had been performing on May 23, 2017. (Reuters: Andrew Yates)

item.title: Turkey summons US ambassador over violence during Washington visit
item.description: Turkey summons the US ambassador to protest the "aggressive and unprofessional" treatment of Turkish security officials in Washington during a visit by President Recep Tayyip Erdogan last week, the Foreign Ministry says.

media:group.media:description: US ambassador John Bass reportedly told Turkey its guards violated US laws. (AP: Adem Altan, file)

item.title: Verrender: Regional bank credit downgrade backs big bank levy
item.description: If the major banks ever had a persuasive argument against the Federal Government's new levy, it was swept away by Standard & Poor's credit downgrade of all their smaller rivals.
item.dc:creator: Ian Verrender

media:group.media:description: Pedestrians walk past a Bank of Queensland ATM in Queen Street Mall in Brisbane (AAP: Tony Phillips - file photo)

item.title: 'I've never felt so scared in my life': Witnesses describe concert mayhem
item.description: Numerous witnesses describe the scene before and after the deadly Manchester Arena concert explosion, with one saying "the whole building shook".

media:group.media:description: A still from a video showing a loud bang heard in Manchester Arena on Mary 22, sparking panic and forcing an evacuation. (Supplied)

item.title: Australia's most iconic sites underwater in new climate modelling
item.description: Sydney's Circular Quay and Botanic Gardens, Brisbane Airport, Melbourne's Docklands and Perth's Elizabeth Quay will all be underwater in dramatic new climate modelling predicting a sea level rise of 2 metres in just over 80 years.
item.dc:creator: Tom Wildie

media:group.media:description: Tourists would be disappointed at a visit to Sydney under new climate change modelling. (Supplied: Coastal Risk Australia 2100)

item.title: Homeschooled kids ready for international Lego battle
item.description: A team of homeschooled students will this week travel overseas, most of them for the first time, to compete in an international Lego robotics competition in Denmark.
item.dc:creator: Amanda Hoh

media:group.media:description: Each pair has two and a half minutes to get their robot to complete as many tasks as possible. (ABC Radio Sydney: Amanda Hoh)

item.title: Former Australian Open boys' champ fined $500 for match fixing
item.description: Former Australian junior tennis champion Oliver Anderson threw the first set in a match at a regional tournament because he needed to pay a debt and believed he would not get caught, a court hears.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Asher

media:group.media:description: Oliver Anderson was the junior boys' Australian Open champion last year. (AAP: Lukas Coch)

item.title: AFL to launch immediate crackdown on jumper punches
item.description: The AFL will waste no time trying to eradicate the jumper punch, with suspensions likely to be on offer for offenders after a mid-season rule change.

media:group.media:description: The jumper punch will become a thing of the past if the AFL has any say. (AAP: Tracey Nearmy)

item.title: One Nation under fire over leaked fundraising proposal
item.description: One Nation's credibility is under renewed attack after an extended recording of a secret meeting revealed more details of a plan to charge inflated prices for campaign material.
item.dc:creator: Louise Yaxley

media:group.media:description: Pauline Hanson looks at staffer James Ashby at a press conference in West Perth, at One Nation Senator Peter Georgiou's offices. May 22, 2017. (ABC News: Jacob Kagi)

item.title: Why do students still go to art school?
item.description: With university fees set to rise, and job prospects in the arts sector remaining bleak, many aspiring creative types are faced with a dilemma: is going to art school worth it?
item.dc:creator: Fiona Pepper

media:group.media:description: Past and present students of the VCA discuss the merits of art school. (ABC RN: Fiona Pepper)

item.title: Dozens of asylum seekers in Canberra at risk of deportation: Legal Aid
item.description: Up to 32 asylum seekers have slipped through the cracks in Canberra and likely do not know about a new deadline to apply for protection visas, Legal Aid ACT says.
item.dc:creator: Jake Evans

media:group.media:description: Immigration Minister Peter Dutton has announced a new October deadline for visa applications. (ABC News: Tegan Osborne)

item.title: Medicinal cannabis funding in Tasmanian budget
item.description: Tasmania's health minister announces $3.75 million in Thursday's state budget to fund specialised support staff for a medicinal cannabis program.

media:group.media:description: $3.75m will be allocated in the state budget for a medicinal cannabis scheme. (Reuters: Baz Ratner)

item.title: Adani royalty debate dominates a fiery Parliament
item.description: Opposition MPs line up to attack the Palaszczuk Government over its indecision on whether to offer Indian miner Adani a royalty holiday, as two people are arrested over an anti-coal protest in Brisbane's south.

media:group.media:description: Police and railway staff cut two protesters free from a train at Tennyson this morning. (ABC News: Terri Begley)

item.title: Live: British PM to hold emergency meeting after Manchester blast
item.description: British PM Theresa May says authorities are working to establish the details of the deadly explosion, adding it is being treated as an "appalling terrorist attack".

media:group.media:description: Bystanders assist an injured man near the Manchester Arena. (Supplied: Goodman/LNP/Rex/Shutterstock)

item.title: Pearce to 'build his legacy' after Origin recall: Johns
item.description: Mitchell Pearce's Origin career has not always been smooth sailing, but Andrew Johns believe this latest recall has come at the perfect time and his performances will go "up and up".

media:group.media:description: Mitchell Pearce is back in a Blues jersey, and Andrew Johns believes he is ready to lead the way. (AAP: Tracey Nearmy)

item.title: Wall St rises on Trump's Saudi defence deal
item.description: A multi-billion-dollar weapons deal between the United States and Saudi Arabia boosts defence-related stocks on Wall Street.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Hyam

media:group.media:description: US President Donald Trump's visit to Saudi Arabia helped seal lucrative defence deals. (AP: Evan Vucci)

item.title: At least 19 killed, 59 hurt in UK concert 'terror attack'
item.description: An explosion following a concert by pop singer Ariana Grande leaves at least 19 dead and scores more injured in the northern English city of Manchester.

media:group.media:description: UK police escort an injured woman outside Manchester Arena after reports of an explosion. (Supplied: Goodman/LNP/Rex/Shutterstock)

item.title: Toy libraries stop plastic treasures becoming trash-pile terrors
item.description: Old, broken or no longer wanted, many plastic toys end up in landfill unless they find their way to a toy library first.
item.dc:creator: Mark Rigby

media:group.media:description: Nearly half of the items stocked at the Darwin Toy Library are rescued from landfill. (ABC Radio Darwin: Mark Rigby)

item.title: Hope in Mutitjulu a decade after the NT intervention began
item.description: Ten years after allegations of abuse and violence in the Indigenous community of Mutitjulu sparked the Northern Territory intervention, locals say very little has been achieved.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Winter

media:group.media:description: Resident Craig Woods says the intervention left men in the community feeling hurt. (ABC News: Caroline Winter)

item.title: WA telescope could shed new light on mystery space signals
item.description: Astronomers could soon be able to pinpoint the origin of mysterious fast radio bursts, after a new telescope in Western Australia detected one after just four days of searching.
item.dc:creator: Tom Wildie

media:group.media:description: The FRB detected by the ASKAP near Geraldton is one of just a few dozen discovered by astronomers. (Supplied: CSIRO)

item.title: Brisbane businesses badly damaged in early morning fire
item.description: At least four businesses in a Brisbane bayside industrial estate suffer significant damage after a fire breaks out early this morning.

media:group.media:description: It took 30 firefighters to bring the blaze under control. (ABC News)

item.title: Live: Australian politicians respond to 'nightmare' Manchester attack
item.description: Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull will update Parliament on the Manchester attack after speaking with his counter-terrorism coordinator. Follow live.

media:group.media:description: Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull looks down while at a speaking event on Tuesday May 23, 2017. (ABC News: Marco Catalano)

item.title: 'Kicking the bucket': How we avoid talking about death
item.description: We use euphemisms about death and dying to soften the blow of the real words, or because we feel awkward being direct. But this can lead to misunderstanding and confusion.

media:group.media:description: Angel in the graveyard at West Terrace Cemetery. (ABC Radio Adelaide: Brett Williamson)

item.title: What questions will authorities have to answer as Lindt inquest findings are delivered?
item.description: It has been a long road for everyone involved in the Sydney siege and the events that led to the December 2014 tragedy.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Kidd

media:group.media:description: Two Australian flags form part of a public tribute to the two hostages killed in Martin Place. (ABC News: Kylie Williams)

item.title: Former MotoGP champion Nicky Hayden dies after cycling accident
item.description: Former MotoGP champion Nicky Hayden dies five days after being hit by a car while cycling in eastern Italy. The American had been in intensive care with severe brain damage since the accident.

media:group.media:description: Hayden returned to MotoGP to replace an injured Dani Pedrosa at Phillip Island in 2016. (AP: Rob Griffith)

item.title: Tasmanian baby seriously ill with rare meningococcal strain
item.description: A Tasmanian baby is in a serious but stable condition after contracting a rare strain of meningococcal disease, but authorities say there is no threat to the wider community.
item.dc:creator: Rhiana Whitson

media:group.media:description: The baby was transferred to the Royal Hobart Hospital from Tasmania's north-west coast. (ABC News)

item.title: Labor pledges to wind back Tasmania's centralised health system
item.description: Tasmania's Opposition will reverse the Government's centralised administration of the health system if it wins next year's state election, Rebecca White says.
item.dc:creator: Rhiana Whitson

media:group.media:description: Rebecca White says the Government needs to listen to doctors before "things get worse". (AAP)

item.title: Solar meter delay adding hundreds to household bills, analysis shows
item.description: New analysis shows solar-powered households in NSW waiting for new smart meters to be installed could pay more than $500 extra for their electricity this year.
item.dc:creator: Amy Bainbridge

media:group.media:description: Solar Analytics' Stefan Jarnason says the delay is costing the average person over $500 a year. (ABC News: Benjamin Sveen)

item.title: 'No-one did anything': Woman's racist train rant caught on camera
item.description: The moment a woman racially abuses an Asian passenger on a Sydney train is caught on camera, as stunned commuters watch on during a minute-long rant.
item.dc:creator: Riley Stuart And Ursula Malone

media:group.media:description: This woman's rant on a train in Sydney was filmed on May 11. (Supplied)

item.title: Flynn refuses to hand over documents in Russia probe
item.description: Former White House national security adviser Michael Flynn will plead the fifth amendment against self-incrimination by refusing to hand over documents to a Senate panel investigating Russia's interference in the 2016 election.

media:group.media:description: Michael Flynn resigned in February after less than a month in the job. (Reuters: Carlos Barria)

item.title: Rolf Harris accuser rejects accusation she fabricated story for financial gain
item.description: A woman who alleges Rolf Harris touched her on the breast when she was a 13-year-old schoolgirl says telling her story is about "vindication and justice", not financial gain.
item.dc:creator: Steve Cannane And Emily Bryan

media:group.media:description: Rolf Harris was accompanied by his niece Jenny Harris when he arrived at court. (ABC News: Emily Bryan)

item.title: Body of fourth climber found near top of Mount Everest
item.description: The body of an Indian climber is found on Mount Everest, the fourth death during a busy and tragic weekend on the world's highest peak.

media:group.media:description: A record 371 permits were issued for people to scale Mount Everest this year. (Reuters: Gopal Chitrakar)

item.title: 'Space pups' bred on Earth from mouse sperm stored on ISS
item.description: Freeze-dried sperm that was stored in space aboard the International Space Station for nine months has been used to produce healthy mouse pups on Earth, but scientists say the results don't tell us much about human reproduction in space.

media:group.media:description: Healthy pups were bred from sperm that spent a record 288 days on the International Space Station (Supplied: Sayaka Wakayama)

item.title: Stolen Generations survivors call for national compensation fund
item.description: Two decades ago, the Bringing Them Home inquiry found Stolen Generations children were subjected to gross human rights violations. Now survivors are renewing their call for a national compensation fund, and better support for an ageing population of people with deep scars.
item.dc:creator: Bridget Brennan And Matt Peacock

media:group.media:description: Michael Welsh was taken from his mother by welfare officers in 1960. (Supplied)

item.title: Resisting the cult of self-improvement
item.description: These days, positive thinking, personal growth and the relentless pursuit of happiness are pretty much moral imperatives, but one expert says it's time to reject the self-improvement ideology, refuse the cult of positive thinking and stand firm.
item.dc:creator: Mira Adler-Gillies

media:group.media:description: The self-help industry often urges people to be present in all they do, but is that making us happier? (Getty Images/mapodile)

item.title: Q&A: Trump impeachment 'won't have anything to do with Russia'
item.description: Following a tumultuous few weeks in US politics, Q&A panellists weigh in on President Donald Trump's chances of getting impeached.

media:group.media:description: (News Video)

item.title: Extended secret recording sheds fresh light on One Nation meeting
item.description: An extended secret recording of a meeting of senior One Nation officials obtained by the ABC contains no evidence they killed off a controversial fundraising proposal.
item.dc:creator: David Lipson And Ashlynne McGhee

media:group.media:description: James Ashby has called the leaks "embarrassing". (ABC News: Jacob Kagi)

item.title: Sponsored refugee resettlement should be increased tenfold: Government MP
item.description: Federal Government MP Andrew Broad is calling for places in Australia's sponsored refugee resettlement program to be increased from 1,000 places a year to 10,000.
item.dc:creator: Ashlynne McGhee

media:group.media:description: MP Andrew Broad is calling for the number of sponsored refugee places to be increased tenfold. (ABC News: Alexandra Beech (file photo))

item.title: Arab states warming to Israel because of Iran 'threat', Trump says in Jerusalem
item.description: Donald Trump becomes the first sitting US President to visit the Western Wall in Jerusalem, saying concern about Iran's "regional threat" is driving Israel and Arab states closer together.

media:group.media:description: US President Donald Trump visits the Western Wall, Monday, May 22, 2017, in Jerusalem. (AP: Evan Vucci)

item.title: How authorities underestimated siege gunman Monis
item.description: The architect of the deadly Lindt Cafe siege had a long and documented history of dangerous behaviour.

media:group.media:description: Sydney siege gunman had many identities in his life: Michael Mavros, Man Monis and Mohammed Manteghi. (ABC News Graphics: Devi Mallal)

item.title: Cash-strapped NT Government under pressure over police, Delia Lawrie
item.description: The Northern Territory Police Association warns the Government has not put aside enough funding for its key promise of recruiting 120 new officers, meanwhile the Government remains tight-lipped on questions relating to the legal bill of its former leader.
item.dc:creator: Alyssa Betts

media:group.media:description: The NT Police Association says Labor has not set aside enough funding for the extra officers. (ABC News)

item.title: St John Ambulance officer faces child sex charges
item.description: A high-ranking St John Ambulance officer faces trial in South Australia's District Court accused of pursuing two underage cadets to engage in sexual activity.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Opie

media:group.media:description: St John Ambulance officer Daniel Symons has pleaded not guilty to 11 child-sex-related charges. (ABC News: Rebecca Opie)

item.title: Unvaccinated child contracts measles overseas sparking Victorian health warning
item.description: Health authorities are urging passengers on a flight from Indonesia to Melbourne earlier this month to seek urgent medical attention after an unvaccinated child was diagnosed with measles.

media:group.media:description: Skin of a patient after three days of measles infection. (Centres for Disease Control)

item.title: Magazine articles tore down Rebel Wilson, court hears
item.description: A lawyer for Australian actress Rebel Wilson tells court she was fired from two Hollywood movies and could not get anymore film roles after magazine articles insinuated she was a serial liar.
item.dc:creator: Emma Younger

media:group.media:description: Actress Rebel Wilson arrived in Melbourne last week ahead of the trial. (AAP: Joe Castro)

item.title: Twiggy Forrest's philanthropy a case of grand goals and gestures
item.description: Monday's "extraordinary act of kindness" a $400 million philanthropic donation was classic Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest, with the mining magnate offering big bucks, surrounded by big names, and proclaiming lofty ambitions.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Long

media:group.media:description: Andrew Forrest was flanked by Malcolm Turnbull and Russell Crowe at the announcement on Monday. (ABC News: Marco Catalano)

item.title: 'Snake' Ashby will bring Hanson 'down in flames', ex-candidate says
item.description: A former One Nation candidate who fell out with the party over the cost of electoral material says James Ashby is "nasty stuff" and will bring Pauline Hanson down.
item.dc:creator: Peter McCutcheon And Michael Atkin

media:group.media:description: Media advisor James Ashby, Pauline Hanson and One Nation's Queensland director Ian Nelson. (ABC News: Michael Atkin)

item.title: Peats, Trbojevic set for big debuts as NSW names its Origin squad
item.description: Nathan Peats will make his State of Origin debut for the Blues after being named in NSW's squad in place of the injured Peter Wallace.

media:group.media:description: Nathan Peats is set to make his State of Origin bow for the Blues. (AAP: Dave Hunt)

item.title: Private girls' school ex-teacher jailed for sex with student
item.description: A sexual relationship with a student initiated by former St Michael's Collegiate School teacher Raynor Bartsch was a serious breach of trust, a sentencing judge says.
item.dc:creator: Rhiana Whitson

media:group.media:description: Ian Bartsch was a teacher and swimming coach at St Michael's Collegiate. (Supplied)

item.title: One Nation's WA leader says keeping party together will be tough
item.description: The leader of One Nation in WA is wary of avoiding a repeat of the party's dramatic disintegration more than a decade ago.
item.dc:creator: Jacob Kagi

media:group.media:description: Mr Tincknell and his One Nation colleagues will command considerable power in the Upper House. (ABC News: Andrew O'Connor)

item.title: National Sports Plan's 'sports court' poses many questions for major codes
item.description: The truly interesting part of the National Sports Plan will be seeing the AFL, NRL and Cricket Australia figure out whether they want to abandon their in-house integrity teams and instead opt into a national integrity commission, writes Mary Gearin.
item.dc:creator: Mary Gearin

media:group.media:description: Major codes like the AFL will need to figure out if they want to opt in to a national integrity commission. (AAP/Mick Tsikas)

item.title: S&P downgrades banks on property crash risk
item.description: Ratings agency S&P Global is downgrading almost all financial institutions in Australia because they face an "increased risk of a sharp correction in property prices".
item.dc:creator: Carrington Clarke

media:group.media:description: S&P believes high house price growth in recent years has left banks vulnerable. (ABC News: Giulio Saggin)

item.title: Facebook should hide suicide live streams, mental health advocates say
item.description: Facebook's policy to allow the live broadcast of self-harm on its platform could put other vulnerable people at harm and place pressure on community members who are unable to help, mental health advocates say.
item.dc:creator: Jake Sturmer

media:group.media:description: The Facebook logo is pictured at the Facebook headquarters in Menlo Park, California January 29, 2013. (Reuters: Robert Galbraith, file)

item.title: One of Central Australia's most eclectic collection of vintage cars up for auction
item.description: A "once-in-a-lifetime" collection of classic cars that belonged to a well-known hoarder in Alice Springs is going under the hammer after his death.
item.dc:creator: Claire Campbell

media:group.media:description: Cars found covered in dust inside a garage at Graeme Phillips' Alice Springs home. (Supplied)

item.title: Climate 'shares' proposal touted by water reform expert
item.description: Professor Mike Young, an Adelaide water reform expert who played a vocal role in the lead-up to the Murray Darling Basin Plan's implementation, says a similar scheme should be used to address climate change.
item.dc:creator: Isabel Dayman

media:group.media:description: University of Adelaide's Professor Mike Young presented his idea at a Rural Media SA luncheon in Adelaide. (ABC News: Isabel Dayman)

item.title: How 'mental health smart' were you?
item.description: If you were one of the more than 16,000 people who completed ABC's How mental health smart are you? quiz a couple of years back, your answers have been put to good use.
item.dc:creator: Cathy Johnson

media:group.media:description: Gaps in knowledge about mental health are obstacles to people seeking help. (Getty: Gary Waters)

item.title: CommInsure customer faces home insurance nightmare after storm damage
item.description: After Meri Pomery's house was severely damaged in a storm, she thought CommInsure would look after her. But her house is still unliveable two-and-a-half-years later.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Robertson

media:group.media:description: Meri Pomery's house two-and-a-half years after the storm damage. (Supplied: Meri Pomery)

item.title: 'Drug runner' may have drowned in river during police chase, inquest told
item.description: A 22-year-old man who was involved in a police pursuit across New South Wales may have drowned in the Nepean River as he tried to escape, an inquest hears.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Chettle

media:group.media:description: Jordan Morris went missing in April 2015. (Supplied: Australian Missing Persons Register)

item.title: Baby dugongs' return shows seagrass recovering from cyclone
item.description: An increase in the number of baby dugongs on the Great Barrier Reef suggests seagrass ecosystems are recovering well after recent flood and cyclone events.
item.dc:creator: Robert Baird And Nathalie Fernbach

media:group.media:description: Scientists are buoyed by the return of dugong calves and mothers to the reef. (Supplied: Great Barrier Reef Marine Park Authority)

item.title: TPP deal still on the table despite no US involvement
item.description: Australia, Japan and other members of the Trans-Pacific Partnership agree to pursue their trade deal without the United States.

media:group.media:description: The 11 remaining TPP countries agree to explore options without the US. (Reuters Graphics: Jessica Wang)

item.title: Dozens injured in Bangkok hospital bombing
item.description: A bomb blast at a hospital in Thailand's capital Bangkok injures 24 people on the third anniversary of the country's 2014 military coup.

media:group.media:description: There was no claim of responsibility for the blast at the Phramongkutklao Hospital. (AP: Sakchai Lalit)

item.title: Online petition calls for malnourished son of anti-vaxxer to be returned home
item.description: Supporters of a prominent anti-vaxxer whose young son with cerebral palsy was taken by police and family services launch an online petition to have him returned.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Whyte

item.title: Adani indefinitely postpones final decision on Carmichael coal mine
item.description: Indian mining giant Adani defers its final investment decision on the Carmichael coal mine until the Queensland Government gives "clarity" over lower or deferred royalties.

media:group.media:description: The Adani board was to meet in India next week for final approval but has postponed the meeting. (AAP)

item.title: Citizenship, visa waiting times could increase amid Immigration staff cuts
item.description: Immigration Department secretary Mike Pezzullo says he cannot guarantee people will not have to wait longer for visas or Australian citizenship to be granted because of cutbacks at the department.
item.dc:creator: Louise Yaxley

media:group.media:description: The Immigration Department has to find nearly $1 billion dollars in savings, Mr Pezzullo says. (ABC News: Nic MacBean)

item.title: An Origin smokescreen? Billy Moore ponders Thurston's 18th man status
item.description: Are Queensland playing tricks with naming Johnathan Thurston as 18th man in their Origin I squad? Even Maroons favourite Billy Moore isn't sure, but he's backing Anthony Milford's ability.
item.dc:creator: James Maasdorp

media:group.media:description: Johnathan Thurston's shoulder injury is expected to ultimately rule him out of Origin I ... or is it? (AAP: Dan Himbrechts)

item.title: Australian climber dies on Mt Everest, trekking company confirms
item.description: Queensland man Francesco Marchetti dies of suspected altitude sickness while attempting to fulfil his "life goal of getting to the top of Mt Everest".
item.dc:creator: James Bennett

media:group.media:description: Queenslander Francesco Enrico Marchetti climbing Kala Pathar in Khumbu, Nepal. (Facebook: Francesco Marchetti)

item.title: More than 100 arrested during raid on Jakarta gay club
item.description: About 140 men have been arrested for pornography, a crime that can carry a jail sentence, during a police raid on the Atlantis gay club in the Indonesian capital.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Hawley

media:group.media:description: Under Indonesian law the men arrested during the raid can be detained for up to 72 hours. (Supplied)

item.title: What chance does Trump have of making the Middle East's 'ultimate deal'?
item.description: Peace between the Palestinians and the Israelis has eluded every single American president, but the United States' unconventional new leader presents both an opportunity and a threat in the long-running conflict, writes Middle East correspondent Sophie McNeill.
item.dc:creator: Sophie McNeill

media:group.media:description: Mr Trump, who met with Mr Netanyahu in February, has Israeli and Palestinian leaders nervous. (AP: Pablo Martinez Monsivais)

item.title: Defence raises suspicions Billy McCulkin killed wife, daughters
item.description: The alleged motive behind the triple murder of the McCulkin family is "ridiculous", with the defence lawyer of the accused instead pointing the finger at a violent husband.
item.dc:creator: Candice Prosser

media:group.media:description: Suspected murder victims Barbara McCulkin (centre) and daughters, Leanne (left) and Vicki (right). (ABC News - file image)

item.title: China faces financial crisis within a decade Gavekal Dragonomics
item.description: A global investment house warns that China faces a financial crisis within the next decade as government and private debt rise to unsustainable levels.
item.dc:creator: Sue Lannin

media:group.media:description: Gavekal Dragonomics economist Anatole Kaletsky says a Chinese crisis is five to 10 years away. (ABC: Sue Lannin)

item.title: Upgrade on Svalbard Global Seed Vault to prevent permafrost melt from harming seeds
item.description: The Norwegian Government will redesign parts of the Global Seed Vault, after a record warm summer caused permafrost to melt and flood the entrance.
item.dc:creator: Sarina Locke

media:group.media:description: Former deputy PM and now Crop Trust deputy Tim Fischer says the vault is invaluable to researchers. (Supplied: Crop Trust)

item.title: Neubert jailed for shooting dead estranged wife at Hobart traffic lights
item.description: Klaus Neubert, who shot and killed his estranged wife in traffic in broad daylight in Hobart and injured her passenger, is sentenced to a total of 28 years for the crimes.

media:group.media:description: Klaus Neubert shot his wife dead as she sat in a car in Hobart traffic two years ago. (ABC News: Janke Frankowski)

item.title: Families question psychiatrist's influence on police in Lindt cafe siege
item.description: The families of Tori Johnson and Katrina Dawson, who died in the Sydney siege, say police commanders relied too heavily on the advice of a psychiatrist, who suggested gunman Man Haron Monis was "grandstanding".

media:group.media:description: Katrina Dawson and her mother Jane Dawson. (Supplied)

item.title: 'Game is up' for 'fake refugees' living in Australia, Dutton says

item.title: Family reported missing in contact with police

item.title: 'Resource-starved' SA coroner promised more funding by Xenophon

item.title: Fears transition to NDIS will put vulnerable people on the streets

item.title: Online trolls: What if we killed them with kindness?

item.title: Who's who of those alleged to be behind ATO fraud conspiracy
item.description: Take a look at the main players alleged to be behind a conspiracy to defraud the Australian Tax Office of $165 million.

media:group.media:description: ATO deputy commissioner Michael Cranston has been suspended from his position following the charges. (AAP: Paul Miller)

item.title: Cats beat Bulldogs to snap AFL losing streak
item.description: Geelong ends a three-match losing run with a gritty 23-point victory over AFL premiers Western Bulldogs at Kardinia Park on Friday night.

media:group.media:description: Tom Hawkins (left) and Harry Taylor of the Cats shake hands during the round nine AFL match against the Bulldogs in Geelong on May 19, 2017. (AAP: Julian Smith)

item.title: Assange won't 'forgive or forget' as rape investigation dropped
item.description: Swedish prosecutors are dropping an investigation into sex crime allegations against Julian Assange, but the WikiLeaks founder swears he will not "forgive or forget" after being "detained for seven years without charge".

media:group.media:description: Julian Assange delivers a speech on the balcony of the Ecuadorian Embassy in London. (Reuters: Peter Nicholls)

item.title: 'No-vaccine playgroup' puts kids and community at risk: AMA
item.description: WA's peak medical body warns parents considering joining a no-vaccination playgroup advertised on social media that the consequences of a disease outbreak could be severe for their kids and the community.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Trigger

media:group.media:description: Hepatitis vaccine (AFP: Robyn Beck)

item.title: Tassal given three months to clean up Macquarie Harbour leases
item.description: Australia's largest salmon producer is told to clean up its act at two leases on Tasmania's west coast or it risks losing its stamp of approval for aquaculture practices.
item.dc:creator: Georgie Burgess

media:group.media:description: The report relates to two Tassal sites in Macquarie Harbour. (Supplied: Tassal)

item.title: Shades of Watergate in Trump's week of scandal
item.description: A clandestine theft, key officials sacked and rumours of tapes in the Oval Office it's no wonder the word "impeachment" has been uttered in Washington this week as the parallels between Richard Nixon and Donald Trump grow.
item.dc:creator: Sara James

media:group.media:description: There are some parallels in the scandals of Richard Nixon and Donald Trump. (Reuters)

item.title: Woman raped, bashed by ex fears one day he will be free 'to finish the job'
item.description: A woman felt she was "looking into the eyes of Satan" when she was raped and bashed by her former partner, and says she now lives "as a corpse with no future", an ACT court hears.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Byrne

item.title: Navy veteran charged with murder over Times Square carnage
item.description: Richard Rojas, the 26-year-old navy veteran who steered his car onto a footpath in Times Square in New York, killing one person and injuring 22 others, is charged with one count of murder and multiple counts of attempted murder.

media:group.media:description: Mr Rojas had returned from the Navy with a drinking problem and other behavioural issues, his friend said. (Reuters: Stephanie Keith)

item.title: Rolf Harris released from prison ahead of court appearance
item.description: Australian entertainer Rolf Harris is released from Stafford Prison and will attend court in person next week as he pleads not guilty to four counts of indecent assault.
item.dc:creator: Steve Cannane

media:group.media:description: Harris will plead not guilty to four charges of indecent assault when he appears in court on Monday. (ABC News)

item.title: Boxer David Browne 'looked OK' right before fatal blow, ringside inspector says
item.description: Combat sports inspector Paul Toweel says boxer David Browne appeared OK before the final punch that killed the father of two, but he asks himself every day if he should have done something differently.
item.dc:creator: Nicole Chettle

media:group.media:description: David Browne died after being knocked unconscious during a super featherweight title fight in Sydney. (facebook: Aus-Boxing)

item.title: Broncos thrash Tigers, Dragons down Warriors
item.description: The Broncos keep the Tigers scoreless in a 36-0 thrashing, while the Dragons celebrate a 30-14 win over the Warriors in New Zealand. Look back at all the scores and stats that mattered with our ScoreCentre.

media:group.media:description: Tautau Moga of the Broncos leaps over the Tigers defence to score a try during their round 11 NRL match in Brisbane on May 19, 2017. (AAP: Dan Peled)

item.title: New York man allegedly uses Snapchat to lure 16yo Sydney girl across globe for sex
item.description: Families are being warned to educate their kids about the dangers of social media, after a 16-year-old Sydney girl was allegedly lured by a 39-year-old man to America for sex.
item.dc:creator: Kathleen Calderwood

media:group.media:description: The Snapchat logo taken on November 2, 2015. (Supplied: Snapchat)

item.title: ASX ends the week in the red, weighed down by banks and retailers
item.description: Despite a positive lead from Wall Street and a strong session from the miners, the banks dragged the market down to its fourth successive daily loss.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Letts

media:group.media:description: Investors continue to withdraw from the banking sector, driving the ASX down for the fourth straight day (ABC: Michael Janda)

item.title: Man accused of posting anti-Semitic videos pleads not guilty to advocating terrorism
item.description: A South Australian man accused of posting videos online encouraging violent acts against Jewish people pleads not guilty in an Adelaide court to advocating terrorism.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Opie

media:group.media:description: It is alleged the man posted videos on how to kill Jewish people. (YouTube)

item.title: Remote cave sheds light on lives of the earliest Australians
item.description: Part of the land inhabited by some of the early Australians is now submerged, but details of their life are revealed in an excavation on an island off Western Australia.

media:group.media:description: Three main excavation squares within Boodie Cave. (Supplied: Peter Veth)

item.title: Man who planned Curtis Cheng murder pleads guilty to terrorist act
item.description: A 19-year-old man who planned a plot that led to the death of Sydney police accountant Curtis Cheng in 2015 pleads guilty to committing a terrorist act.
item.dc:creator: Michelle Brown And Jessica Kidd

media:group.media:description: Raban Alou was accused of supplying a gun to Mr Cheng's killer. (ABC: 7.30)

item.title: Colin Barnett 'cutting a sad, lonely figure', Premier says
item.description: WA Premier Mark McGowan accuses his predecessor Colin Barnett of showing a lack of grace and dignity, and of being reminiscent of federal leaders Mark Latham and Tony Abbott.

media:group.media:description: Mr McGowan says Liberal MPs were embarrassed by Mr Barnett's speech. (ABC News: James Carmody)

item.title: Navy can't rule out design faults as cause of warship woes
item.description: The Royal Australian Navy concedes there may be design faults with its two largest ships, which have been docked in Sydney since March undergoing urgent repair work.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Greene

media:group.media:description: HMAS Adelaide will no longer participate in planned Talisman Sabre exercises with the US. (ABC News: Billy Cooper)
